H0.text: Which wedge-shaped writing system was used by various middle-eastern peoples from the fourth millennium BC until the invention of alphabetic systems. Hieroglyphic

H1.text: Which wedge-shaped writing system was used by various middle-eastern peoples from the fourth millennium BC until the invention of alphabetic systems. Sumerian Script

H2.text: Which wedge-shaped writing system was used by various middle-eastern peoples from the fourth millennium BC until the invention of alphabetic systems. Phoenician Alphabet

H3.text: Which wedge-shaped writing system was used by various middle-eastern peoples from the fourth millennium BC until the invention of alphabetic systems. CUNEIFORM

A4.text: Cuneiform is a logo-syllabic writing system that was used to write several languages of the ancient Near East.

A5.text: The cuneiform script was developed from pictographic proto-writing in the late 4th millennium BC, stemming from the Near Eastern token system used for accounting.
